75776.name: Peggle
videogamehonor: 2008 D.I.C.E. Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
2008 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Winner
75776.description:
From the back cover:

Luck and skill and joyous thrills!

Strategize and set your sights on clearing the orange pegs, then sit back and cheer yourself to Peggle greatness. And just when you think you've mastered Peggle, there's more challenging fun in store!

From the marketing flap:


Take Your Best Shot - Clear the orange pegs from 55 spectacular levels! Through snowbanks, outer space, tulip fields and more, you'll need both luck and skill to become a Peggle Master.



Master Magic Powers - Hone your skills with the help of 10 whimsical teachers. Learn their marvelous Magic Powers to make shots you'll want to replay for weeks!



Rise to Peggle Greatness - You've made it to Master... but you've only just begun. Raise the Fevermeter with 75 Grand Master challenges - or play friends in Duel Mode.

75777.name: TRI 1 - Spieler
75777.description:
User summary

TRI 1 is the player's handbook of TRI. It contains an introduction into the background setting, rules for character creation, dice mechanics, combat and magic, and special rules for Mistrunners.

75778.name: TRI 2 - Welten
75778.description:
User summary

TRI 2 gives an in-depth view of the three different worlds Terra, Rulegard, and ION. It covers history, regions and cities, technology and magic.

75779.name: Techno
75779.description:
From the back of the book

Slap down ya' Dutches!

Want a little sumthin' to strap on where that failure of an arm used to be?
Need a new "Hazel" to chase after the brats?
Wanna listen in on that damn neighbour when he's abusin' the little woman?

Baby, this is the 21st Century... Sit back, kick up your feet and shop at home!

Thinkin' of buyin' some:

Computers, Packs, or Peripherals?
Robots?
State of the art medical technology?
Surveillance or security gear?
Replacement limbs?
Fully-licensed lockpicks?
Radical cosmetic surgery?
Ultra-chic digital watch implants?




Take a few to peruse our fully-illustrated TECHNO catalog. Inside you'll find:

96 pages of stats and information on the various gear and accessories you can't live without.
32 perforated technology pages for you to peel out and stick in your Underground Notebook.

75780.name: Ways and Means
75780.description:
From the back of the book

...and justice for all.

So, Undergrounder, you finally made it. You've reached the place all roads lead to. The belly of the beast. The ninth layer of Hell. The top floor of Babel. The diseased liver of the nation. Washington D.C.: Democracy City. Yeah, you've finally found the HQ of the real bad guys. They're not like the villains we fought in the Slumberland VR program. They don't jam around with capes and masks and wigged-out codenames. They don't stick you in death traps and gloatingly spill their whole plot to you as you wriggle free of your bonds. They don't even bother with Punkbusters or EP450s. Their weapon is the stroke of the pen, the subclause of death here is not the metallic patang of a round being ratcheted into the chamber. It's the whispering sound a briefcase full of money makes when it gets slid across a mahogany desk.

Ways and Means comes packed with:

Complete information on the Nation's Capitol.
Tons of dirt on the movers and shakers of Democracy City for your vet to dig up.
Scenarios to get your punks primed for action in the big city.
Pull-out pages on the people, places, and things of D.C. for you to slip into your Underground Notebook.

75781.name: Race for Retribution
75781.description:
User summary

Race for Retribution compiles the complete A Race for Retribution series into a single print product. It contains four saddle-stapled booklets inside a color softcover sleeve.


From the back of the book

A vile injustice.
A vengeful priest.
A ruined hall.
A racial artifact.
A terrified town.
A traitorous assassin.
A dark awakening.
A deadly alliance.
The Race Comes!

Special features make this series great for the experienced DM short on time as well as the novice DM starting their first campaign. These include:

Time Savers

Challenging and detailed battle tactics with each encounter reduce DM preparation time.
Full stat blocks for monsters, doors, locks, etc. reduce DM lookup time for every encounter
Mid adventure DM suggestions to help adjust difficulty level on-the-fly




Convenience Features

Like modules of old the outer cover can be a DM screen and quick reference to full color maps
Separate books for each part allows the DM to physically mix in other material with Race for Retribution in their campaign binder
Includes a small but detailed area setting, two towns and dozens of NPCs as a solid framework from which to start a new campaign




Campaign Features

Unlike other large scale modules Race for Retribution allows the DM to use additional adventures without interrupting the overall story
Contains a unique rumor system which provides storyline continuity even if players take a side trip
Includes suggestions for making each part a stand-alone adventure




With four distinct module styles - including event based murder mystery and real time fortress stealth infiltration - Race for Retribution provides both "roll" and roleplayers hours of enjoyment.

75782.description:
In Phantom League, you are the captain of a merchant spaceship. You begin as a nobody with a hunger for recognition and glory that will soon lead you onto a path of fame or notoriety! Build your career through trading, piracy, exploring new systems and eliminating your rivals in the other Leagues – phantom alliances
powerful enough to challenge law and political order across the known universe. This game features:
• A modular board – every game is different
• Card-driven game play – you, not the dice, are in control of the game
• A wide range of actions and strategies – there is no single best way to win
• Cooperative and competitive interaction – choose when to ally with or conspire against other players

Phantom League is designed for 2-6 players of 12 years and up, and will take approximately 2 hours to play. Phantom League is inspired by David Braben’s video game Elite.
boardgameversion: Dragon Dawn / Tuonela Big Box edition
75782.name: The Phantom League

75783.name: Draco
75783.description:
From the publisher's website:

"It is again time for the great dragon battle held once every century! Control your dragon to breathe fire on the Great Beast in this thrilling skill game. Every time you hit another dragon, your dragon grows. The player/team with the longest dragon at the end of the battle wins. The durable wooden pieces guarantee a lasting hit for all fans of fast paced fun!"

Draco is basically a dexterity game in which you try to knock over pieces of the opponent's or the neutral central dragon by shooting them with wooden disks. Success is rewarded by inclusion of the piece to your own dragon.

75786.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 89 - Mar/Apr 2001))
rpgissuearticle: Plant der garetische Adel einen Siegestempel?
75786.description:
User summary


Contents


Die Leinen los... - Thorwalian ships try to reach their former homeland Hjaldingard.
Plant der garetische Adel einen Siegestempel? - Gareth's nobles plan a temple dedicated to the victory at the Trollpforten.

75787.name: Project Vanguard
75787.description:
Blurb:

Far in the future, humankind is surrounded by threats on all sides, and you’re the only ones who can make a difference. Weakened by infighting, the Commonwealth has turned to special agents like you to help build alliances, weaken enemies and investigate the mystery of a mythical destroyer of worlds known only as the Scourge. You are the operatives of Project Vanguard.

This version, as of 07/18/10, is "Playtest Files #27"

75789.description:
A card game about Japanese geisha by Seiji Kanai.

Players take the roles of various geisha, and compete with the other players to win the legendary title of "Mai-Star". Use the characters surrounding you to increase your popularity, and earn money by attracting guests, the more demanding the better. Focusing only on increasing your popularity won't earn you any money, yet failing to spread your name won't make the rich or helpful guests come your way.
It's a matter of deciding which characters (cards) will help you increase your popularity and which character cards you want to attract as guests.
Once a player runs out of cards, the round is over, and all cards remaining in your hand become minus points, thus depleting your hand of cards quickly is important. Only the one who has attracted the richest guests (earned the most money) after three festival nights (rounds) will be the one who deserves to carry the title of "Mai-Star".

This game's setting is same as Master Merchant.
75789.name: Mai-Star
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 010 – Games we always have with us
Episode 77 Origins preview, Buonocore drops by, and Xmen chat (spoilers)

75790.name: Dépar
75790.description:
User summary:

Dépar is golf dice game teaching and using real golf rules. Each game is an 18-hole course where each player represents a golfer.

A hole is played using six combination dice, two hazard dice and a pro/am die. All the dice are numbered 1 to 6. On a par 3 and par 4 hole the goal is to get three of a kind and four of a kind, respectively. On a par 5 hole the goal is to get a straight, either 1 to 5 or 2 to 6. When rolling the player can also encounter obstacles like water, bunkers, etc.

There are three game modes; beginner course, amateur course and professional course; each adding more rules.

Included in the game:

5 dice known as combination dice
3 special dice
4 golf ball playing pieces
4 flag pieces
1 pencil
1 puzzle game board
1 copy of the game rules with a glossary
1 yardage book
1 book of scorecards
3 point cards
